verses.kjv: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,
verses.ct: Job continued his speech and said,

verses.kjv: Oh that I were as in months past, as in the days when God preserved me;
verses.ct: "If only I could go back to the earlier months, to the days when God watched over me —

verses.kjv: When his candle shined upon my head, and when by his light I walked through darkness;
verses.ct: when his lamp shone over my head, and I walked through the darkness by his light;

verses.kjv: As I was in the days of my youth, when the secret of God was upon my tabernacle;
verses.ct: back when I was in my prime, when God's intimate friendship rested on my household;

verses.kjv: When the Almighty was yet with me, when my children were about me;
verses.ct: when the Almighty was still with me, and my children surrounded me;

verses.kjv: When I washed my steps with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil;
verses.ct: when my paths were drenched in cream, and the rock poured out streams of olive oil for me;

verses.kjv: When I went out to the gate through the city, when I prepared my seat in the street!
verses.ct: when I went out to the city gate and took my seat in the public square!

verses.kjv: The young men saw me, and hid themselves: and the aged arose, and stood up.
verses.ct: Young men would see me and step aside, and the elderly would rise to their feet.

verses.kjv: The princes refrained talking, and laid their hand on their mouth.
verses.ct: Leaders stopped mid-conversation and covered their mouths with their hands.

verses.kjv: The nobles held their peace, and their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.
verses.ct: The voices of prominent men went silent, their tongues stuck to the roofs of their mouths.

verses.kjv: When the ear heard me, then it blessed me; and when the eye saw me, it gave witness to me:
verses.ct: Everyone who heard me spoke well of me, and everyone who saw me had good things to say about me,

verses.kjv: Because I delivered the poor that cried, and the fatherless, and him that had none to help him.
verses.ct: because I rescued the poor when they cried out, and the orphan, and anyone who had no one to help them.

verses.kjv: The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me: and I caused the widow’s heart to sing for joy.
verses.ct: The person on the verge of death blessed me, and I made the widow's heart sing with joy.

verses.kjv: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me: my judgment was as a robe and a diadem.
verses.ct: I wore righteousness like clothing — my justice was like a robe and a turban.

verses.kjv: I was eyes to the blind, and feet was I to the lame.
verses.ct: I served as eyes for the blind and as feet for the lame.

verses.kjv: I was a father to the poor: and the cause which I knew not I searched out.
verses.ct: I was like a father to the poor, and I investigated the cases of people I didn't even know.

verses.kjv: And I brake the jaws of the wicked, and plucked the spoil out of his teeth.
verses.ct: I shattered the jaw of the wicked and snatched their victims right from their teeth.

verses.kjv: Then I said, I shall die in my nest, and I shall multiply my days as the sand.
verses.ct: I thought, 'I will die peacefully at home, and my days will be as countless as grains of sand.'

verses.kjv: My root was spread out by the waters, and the dew lay all night upon my branch.
verses.ct: My roots spread out reaching the water, and dew settled on my branches all through the night.

verses.kjv: My glory was fresh in me, and my bow was renewed in my hand.
verses.ct: My glory stayed fresh within me, and my strength was constantly renewed.

verses.kjv: Unto me men gave ear, and waited, and kept silence at my counsel.
verses.ct: People listened to me and waited; they kept quiet to hear my advice.

verses.kjv: After my words they spake not again; and my speech dropped upon them.
verses.ct: After I spoke, no one argued back; my words settled over them gently.

verses.kjv: And they waited for me as for the rain; and they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.
verses.ct: They waited for me like they wait for rain; they opened their mouths wide as if catching the spring showers.

verses.kjv: If I laughed on them, they believed it not; and the light of my countenance they cast not down.
verses.ct: When I smiled at them, they could hardly believe it, and they did nothing to diminish the approval on my face.

verses.kjv: I chose out their way, and sat chief, and dwelt as a king in the army, as one that comforteth the mourners.
verses.ct: I directed their course and sat as their leader; I lived like a king among his troops, like someone who comforts those who grieve."
